body_content.explanation: a national park (= a large area of land protected by the government because of its natural beauty or because it has a special history) in the southern part of Wales, which is now called by its Welsh name Bannau Brycheiniog National Park:
examples: The castle commands a magnificent vista of the Brecon Beacons National Park.
This year marks five decades of the Brecon Beacons National Park, whose stewardship of the wilderness has been a success.
